text: whether liquidator's remuneration, costs, charges and expenses may be deducted from trust moneys
court has no power under corporations law to fix liquidators' remuneration unless a properly convened meeting of creditors has failed to pass a resolution fixing the remuneration.  companies
company's only remaining creditors are unsecured noteholders
deed governing the issue of the notes vests title to the debts in the trustee for the noteholders
trustee is the only "creditor" for the purpose of corporations law s. 473
trustee formally expressed approval for the remuneration claimed
trustee expressly waived requirement notice and advertising necessary to formally convene a meeting of creditors under corporations law s. 473
declaration that approval constituted a meeting of creditors
application for directions as to the method of approving future claims by liquidators for remuneration refused.  corporations law
